intro: Gaylussacia vauthieri, commonly known as the Vauthier's huckleberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and trees commonly found in acidic soils. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark red to black in color. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and turn vibrant red in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
